suppress.notes: file name: snakeyaml-1.33.jar False positive. CVE is about a maliciously crafted payload causing inefficiency, a potential denial of service vector for a hosted application. This is not a hosted application, this CVE is irrelevant.
file name: junit-jupiter-api-5.9.2.jar False positive. The CVE is about the python web server platform flask, which has nothing to do with the Java unit testing framework JUnit

files: spring-aop.jar, spring-beans.jar, spring-context.jar, spring-core.jar, spring-jcl.jar, spring-messaging.jar, spring-web.jar, spring-webflux.jar, spring-context-support.jar, spring-jdbc.jar, spring-webmvc.jar, spring-websocket.jar sev: CRITICAL CVE-2016-1000027 False positive. Recipes which modify spring code are not themselves spring applications. The vulnerabilities of spring applications are irrelevant.
file name: rewrite-jhipster-1.17.0.jar False positive. Recipe module which affects jhipster applications is not itself a jhipster application.
file name: spring-security-crypto-5.7.1.jar sev: MEDIUM False positive. Affects Spring Security Crypto versions Prior to these 5.3.2, 5.2.4, 5.1.10, 5.0.16 and 4.2.16
file name: junit-platform-engine-1.9.1.jar sev: CRITICAL False positive. Flask send_file function is not used. Nothing is actionable, because 1.9.1 is the latest version.
file name: junit-platform-engine-1.9.1.jar sev: CRITICAL False positive. Flask send_file function is not used. Nothing is actionable, because 1.9.1 is the latest version.
file name: snakeyaml-1.33.jar Severity: HIGH False positive: We are not parsing untrusted user input
